newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul creditors to supply 36.9 bln won to Jinro.
newsitem.headline: Seoul creditors to supply 36.9 bln won to Jinro.

text.p: Creditor banks said on Friday they had decided to supply 36.9 billion won to struggling Jinro Ltd and extend its principal payments until September 30, 1998.

A statement from Jinro's major creditor, Commercial Bank of Korea, said the loan would be given on condition that the Jinro Group chairman hands in a memorandum giving up his management rights to Jinro Ltd.
It said the prime rate would be applied to the extended principle payments.

A bank spokesman said creditors were still in discussion over the future of five other Jinro Group affiliates -- Jinro Industries Co, Jinro General Foods Co, Jinro-Coors Brewing Co, Jinro Construction Co and Jinro Mass Merchandising Inc.
